defs: (a secret) to be divulged, made known to others; to disclose; to reveal.
(fig.) (one's potential, innate capacity, weak points) to be known by his rivals, resulting in one becoming weak.
a mixture of medicine of such a quantity as can be easily swallowed even by children; a tablet.
a wild boar or swine (Sus scrofa) (esp. female).
the plant Tacca integrifolia of Taccaceae family.
its bulbous root.
to form ( a medicine etc.) into pills.
anything that is round or globular.
an archaic coin.
a false statement; a lie.

a secret - a) something kept hidden or unexplained; b) something kept from the knowledge of others or shared only confidentially with a few; c) a method, formula, process or technique used in an art or a manufacturing operation and divulged only to those of one's own company or craft.
(fig.) innate strength or capacity; something potential; a potentiality.

ಗುಟ್ಟು ಬಿಟ್ಟುಕೊಡು guṭṭu biṭṭu koḍu to expose one's secret (esp. in breach of trust); ಗುಟ್ಟು ರಟ್ಟಾಗು guṭṭu raṭṭā gu (a secret) to be divulged; to become known to others; ಗುಟ್ಟು ರಟ್ಟುಮಾಡು guṭṭu raṭṭu māḍu = ಗುಟ್ಟು ಬಿಟ್ಟುಕೊಡು.
= ಗುಟ್ಟುಮಾಡು.
to divulge a secret.
a man who does not leak out secrets.
a killing the cause or the doeṛs identification of which remains unknown.
to meet or assemble in secret.
to keep (something) from otherś knowledge; to maintain a secret or secrets.
something said, conveyed which is to be kept as a secret.

a drink made of jaggery (and with lime, elephant apple, etc.).
